column5: Hellooo!  Had some time the other night and hit the peer.  Thought to myself that it was gonna just another night, so my expectations were low.  Saw some folks working the water when I got there, but was told that there wasn't much doing..  Started casting cleos and HJs, and switched to the good ol glow in the dark when the sun started setting.  I almost fell in when my rod doubled over with the run of a solid fish, but was broken off about a hundred yards out, give or take..  All I had left were 5/8s, but still managed some good distance.  Another hit, and a great battle insued!  After multiple breaches and solid runs, I thought for sure I had hooked into a steelhead...  Turns out that it was a Coho!!    And the promo shot..    cheers  HD
Un Krisss de beau poisson Fidel. Thanks for showing us...especially that second money shot.  :-)  A beautiful, clean fish.

Nice going Fidel!  What you said is something I will have to keep in mind when I go the pier, even after guys are leaving and saying "not much doin" , I will look past that and think of this post.....and probably still catch nothing, but hey, I'll keep pluggin away.  Again, nice going.
Nice going hope to be catchin some myself !! Nice Pics too.
WOW that is a nice fish and a great time.
Nice fish, McFiddler!  Good to see you're still at it, Fidel....
....Sweet looking fish there Fidel. I'd be happy to see them replace the chinooks with cohos anythime. Almost as good as steel.
Wow...what a beautiful fish!  Great job out there!
The Chrome "Footballs". Beautiful fish man!! Well done.
That sure is a sweet looking fish - congrats!  007
Sweet fish! Gotta love the OFC towel
I think you could have done better.
Sweet fish!  Chrome as a set of pimped up rims.
Nice fish, love the promo shot.
